Line 3: Line 3:
[[Virtual appliance]]s are a subset of software appliances. The main distinction is the packaging format and the specificity of the target platform. A virtual appliance image is designed to run on a specific virtualization platform, while a software appliance is often packaged in more generally applicable image format (e.g., [[Live CD]]) that supports installations to physical machines and multiple types of virtual machines.
[[Virtual appliance]]s are a subset of software appliances. The main distinction is the packaging format and the specificity of the target platform. A virtual appliance image is designed to run on a specific virtualization platform, while a software appliance is often packaged in more generally applicable image format (e.g., [[Live CD]]) that supports installations to physical machines and multiple types of virtual machines.
â
Installing a software appliance to a virtual machine creates a [[virtual appliance]].
+
Installing a software appliance to a virtual machine and packaing that, creates a [[virtual appliance]].
